justification: In the behavioural task, "Subjects decided which digit was presented and then reported their confidence on a scale from 1-4," indicating that confidence was operationalised with a four-level rating scale.

The paper states that "A popular example of this strategy is the Softmax transformation, which is currently the standard method for computing confidence in neural networks," identifying Softmax as an instrument for deriving confidence values.

measured_by: Entropy of evidence distribution across choices
justification: It notes that "Another confidence strategy that also uses the spread across all choice options is to compute the entropy of the evidence distribution across choices (Entropy strategy)," describing entropy as a procedure to quantify confidence.

measured_by: Top2Diff (difference between evidence for the two most likely options)
justification: The manuscript explains that "confidence may be computed as the difference in evidence between the two most likely options (Top2Diff strategy)," explicitly linking the Top2Diff computation to the measurement of confidence.

The authors describe the PE approach: "confidence only considers the evidence in favor of the chosen response (i.e., the 'positive evidence'), neglecting all evidence against the choice (PE strategy)," indicating this heuristic is used to measure confidence.
